name: Dinner Tonight: Eggs in Purgatory (Eggs Baked in Tomato Sauce)
description: Interpreting Catholic metaphors is not one of my specialties, and it's probably for the best. I'm not exactly sure what relationship tomato sauce has with temporal punishment and eternal purification. But I do know that this recipe, which combines the...
recipeIngredient: 1 small white or yellow onion, minced
(Alternatively, replace the above ingredients with a leftover tomato sauce)
Sea salt and freshly ground pepper to taste
8 slices thickly cut rustic Italian bread

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat the oven to 375ºF. In a large skillet or saucepan, heat the olive oil over medium heat and saute the garlic and onion until lightly brown, about ten minutes. Add the tomatoes and bring to a boil, then lower to a simmer and cook for 20 minutes, until the sauce thickens.
Bake uncovered for 12-15 minutes, until the whites are set and the yolks are still a bit runny. In the last five minutes of cooking, put the bread in the oven to toast.
Serve the eggs with sauce on toast, and top with Parmigiano-Reggiano. Drizzle with olive oil and serve immediately.
